vague_description: Determine the optimal allocation strategy for ad placements to achieve maximum exposure under given constraints.
detailed_description: A cleaning company located in Edmonton wants to get the best exposure possible for promoting their new dishwashing detergent without exceeding their \param{B} advertising budget. To do so, the company decides to spend their money on two forms of advertising: (1) radio ads and (2) social media ads. Each radio ad costs \param{Cr}; each social media ad costs \param{Cs}. The expected exposure, based on industry ratings, is \param{Er} viewers for each radio ad. Additionally, the expected exposure for each social media ad is \param{Es} viewers. The company decides that at least \param{MinR} but no more than \param{MaxR} radio ads should be ordered, and that at least \param{MinS} social media ads should be contracted. How many ads of each type should be run to obtain maximum exposure while staying within the budget?
target_objective: Maximize the total exposure, in terms of viewers, from both radio and social media ads
target_constraints: Total cost of ads must not exceed budget B
At least MinR radio ads should be ordered
No more than MaxR radio ads should be ordered
At least MinS social media ads should be contracted
target_parameters: Cost of one social media ad
Expected exposure per social media ad
Minimum number of social media ads
